title: Júlio Coelho
text:
Júlio Manuel Pires Coelho (born 18 July 1984) is a Portuguese <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="U.D.%20Oliveirense">U.D. Oliveirense</a> as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Pa%C3%A7os%20de%20Ferreira">Paços de Ferreira</a>, Coelho spent the vast majority of his career with hometown club <a href="F.C.%20Pa%C3%A7os%20de%20Ferreira">F.C. Paços de Ferreira</a>. After playing through the youth ranks since the age of 11, he made the first team in 2003.
After two years and only one <a href="Segunda%20Liga">Segunda Liga</a> appearance, Coelho was loaned to lowly <a href="S.L.%20Nelas">S.L. Nelas</a> and <a href="Rebordosa%20A.C.">Rebordosa AC</a>. After some good performances with the former he was recalled by Paços, but again only served as a backup, consecutively to <a href="Pedro%20Correia%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201974%29">Pedro</a> – another youth product born in the city – and Brazilian <a href="Peterson%20Pe%C3%A7anha">Peterson Peçanha</a>; the first of his 20 <a href="Primeira%20Liga">Primeira Liga</a> matches during his spell at the "<a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20da%20Mata%20Real">Estádio da Mata Real</a>" took place on 6 January 2008, in a 2–1 home win against <a href="U.D.%20Leiria">U.D. Leiria</a>.
Released in the summer of 2012 after <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Liga%20de%20Honra">one season</a> in the second division with <a href="C.F.%20Os%20Belenenses">C.F. Os Belenenses</a>, Coelho resumed his career in that level, with <a href="F.C.%20Penafiel">F.C. Penafiel</a>. He only missed one game from 42 in <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Segunda%20Liga">2013–14</a>, as the latter returned to the top flight after an eight-year absence; in January 2014 and June 2016, he agreed to contract extensions.
